transcripts.text: This is Austin from Raw Bliss and I'm going to show you guys how to open a coconut.
Look, I'm so skinny.  Please don't worry, I'm eating a lot of food these days.  I've got access to avocados and coconut meat now and eating them in abundance.

Hello friends, as some of you know, I've had my experience with veganism or better still, plant-based eating where you eat nothing but plants several years ago to the point where I was a plant eater for three years.  Originally, I turned to veganism as a way to boost my health.  Back then, I was so brainwashed into thinking that vegetables, fruits, nuts and seeds is all we need to be healthy, fit and strong.  I surrounded myself with vegan propaganda in a form of watching daily YouTube videos from Durian Rider, Freely the Banana Bitch and many other so-called health-based channels that promote veganism.  Heck, I even met Durian Rider in person at the fruit festival in Chiang Mai, Thailand back in 2014.  I used to think that all world problems can be solved if everyone started eating plants and nothing but.  Also maybe some grass.  Well, joking, the second part.  I completely alienated my family who could no longer cook for my liking.  Anything my mom and dad cooked was animal flesh and I could no longer eat it.  My friends stopped wanting to hang out with me because all I wanted to talk about was how beneficial the veg and fruit diet was.  Seriously.  You see, I thought I was a health expert after binge-watching Dr.  Michael Greger, the healthy and wholesome Dr.  Michael Greger, where he labeled eating eggs as bad as smoking a packet of cigarettes and watching reruns of Forks Over Knives.  I knew and felt that I was a complete health expert when it comes to nutrition.  I downloaded tons and tons of Neil Barnard lectures where he quite effectively told everyone to ditch dairy cheese for vegan cheese and how it's so much healthier to eat seitan, which is pure gluten, instead of a real chicken breast.  I did not know it back then, but I was now a part of a global vegan cult where veganism was a religion and the motto was, quote, if you aren't with us, you are against us.  Either you are with us or you are with the terrorists.  I tried my best to recruit as many people into veganism as possible, but the funny thing is, according to the hardcore vegans, I wasn't even a vegan, because I had not one, but two leather jackets.  My shoes were made out of leather.  I drove my car with leather seats on public roads which had animal fat in it.  And countless other products and services are used on a daily basis when not vegan.  So you see, it's practically impossible to follow a vegan lifestyle unless you're a deer or a chicken.  Oh, but wait!  Thank you.  I even got my then girlfriend at the time to make vegan Russian and Ukrainian food which is a complete abomination because Russian foods such as borscht, dumplings and many different salads were delicious due to great tasting animal products such as seafood, beef, eggs and dairy.  Mind you, my girlfriend and her family had enough of my vegan propaganda so we broke up not long after.  Eventually, after three years of eating nothing but vegetables, fruits, nuts, and seeds, and occasional vegan junk food such as soy cheese and vegan soy meat, I started developing some serious health issues.  My weight dropped by almost 10 kilograms, and I was already lean back then even before I started the vegan nightmare.  But now I look frail and gaunt.  By now, well and truly, I had mental issues and an ongoing depression.  Little everyday things such as sad music and when things didn't go according to me would set me off in fits of rage and depression.  After the breakup with my then girlfriend, I seriously started contemplating quitting veganism and going back to eating meat, eggs and other animal products.  My family was excited with the news that I dumped the vegan way of eating.  After I resumed eating chicken, eggs, lamb, seafood, I've always loved seafood actually and beef, I started gaining muscle mass.  My overall mood drastically improved.  I became happy again.  My mental clarity improved and I was generally happy for the first time in the last three years.  Suffice to say that damage has been done to my body by eating like a vegan but I'm confident I can overcome this as long as I stick to a natural diet of animal products just like our ancestors have been following for thousands of years.  Veganism has only been around for 50 or 60 years because no other tribe of civilization thrived on plants, seeds and nuts.  It's just ridiculous.  We always hunted, had domesticated animals for farming and hunted the ocean for seafood and fish.  You see, my friends, humans need animal products to sustain mental and physical health for life.  We are not designed to digest plant fiber and thriving on a plant-based diet is short of impossible.  You will need to be taking a host of artificial vitamins and always monitoring your blood levels for zinc, which vegan diet completely destroyed.  I essentially took the test and the doctor said I had literally no zinc in my blood and it's very important for maintaining skin health.  immune health and also being a man, you know, having balls, having sperm and getting women pregnant.  I could not even probably do that back then.  Iron, vitamin B12 and many other crucial vitamins that we can only get from animal foods.  I first discovered veganism back in 2012 and since then I saw many long-term popular vegans quit the cult of veganism as they became sick and malnourished.  They became anemic.  gaunt and looking like concentration camp prisoners.  As soon as they jump back onto eating animal products, their health and vitality literally improve within several days.  The way they get you to accept veganism is they tell you that veganism is the best diet for health.  It simply is not true.  We need cholesterol to make hormones, saturated fat, animal derived vitamins such as A, B6, B12, D, F, and K2, and amino acids creatine, carnitine, carnosine, and taurine, heme iron, coenzyme Q10, and CLA.  This is why vegans feel and look like absolute shit on a plant-based diet.  They're malnourished, very skinny, and their body is cannibalizing itself.  And they also make you feel guilty.  Vegans love to point out that 100% of all meat, eggs and dairy come from abused animals, which are raised in factory farming.  And that is not true.  I tell everyone to avoid factory farming.  Don't buy caged eggs.  Go for organic, free-range eggs.  There's so many small markets where you can actually go and buy directly from farmers, animals.  The only form of veganism that is acceptable is during religious fasting where people abstain from eating meat for a short period of time but then go back to eating their traditional diet which is rich in animal products.  But don't take it from me.  I am only one of the hundreds of thousands of people who have successfully quit the cult of veganism and went back to eating a natural animal-based diet that we have thrived as humans for thousands of years.  People today are getting sick and fat from eating too many carbs, sugar, rancid seed oils, food additives, farm chemicals,  etc.,  while at the same time not getting enough quality pasture-raised animal foods, raw dairy, eggs, organ meats, bone broth, and other important animal products.
